title: Installer script doesn't report missing of yacc
body:
by **itsnotvalid**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. A system without yacc installed
2. run ./all.bash as in documentation
3. failed to get it compiled, but no indication of failure because of yacc

What is the expected output?
Some error messages on missing yacc(bison)

What do you see instead?
no error message

Which operating system are you using?
Ubuntu 10.10, with 'install' 'ed' 'gawk' 'gcc' 'libc6-dev' 'make' installed, but without
'bison'

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
c5c62aeb6267 tip

Consequently, if any of the libraries/command tools is missing, it is trivial to have
them pointed out in configuration stage. Haven't tested other cases of missing since
I've them installed already.
